demolition

Class DynamicMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • demolition.DynamicMatrix

  • public class DynamicMatrix
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DynamicMatrix()
      Constructs the two maps which will be drawn onto the screen, with "W" corresponding to solid walls, "B" corresponding to broken walls and " " corresponding to empty tiles

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLevel1()
      Returns the map displaying the first level of the game

      Returns the map displaying the second level of the game
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> replaceBrokenWall(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> level, int x, int y)
      Updates the map by replacing a broken wall with an empty tile and returning the new map to be displayed
      void resetLevel1(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> level1)
      Resets the map of the first level to its default appearance
      void resetLevel2(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> level2)
      Resets the map of the second level to its default appearance

      • replaceBrokenWall

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> replaceBrokenWall(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> level,
                                                               int x,
                                                               int y)
        Updates the map by replacing a broken wall with an empty tile and returning the new map to be displayed
        Parameters:
        level - the specific level of which the map is to be updated
        x - the x coordinate of the broken wall
        y - the y coordinate of the broken wall
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing an updated map with the broken wall replaced by an empty tile
